member.name: M:EPiServer.Shell.WebForms.ContentWebFormsBase.QueryDistinctAccess
member.summary: Verify that access control requirements are met for the current web request.
member.returns: True if access requirements are met.
member.remarks: This method simply checks that all bits set in are set in .

member.name: M:EPiServer.Shell.WebForms.ContentWebFormsBase.CheckAccess
member.summary: Verify that access control requirements are met for the current web request.
member.remarks:
This method is called as part of the ContentWebForm.OnInit method. It determines the current user's access level and compares it to the current page. If the user does not have sufficient access, the ContentWebForm.AccessDenied method will be called.
Will trigger an AccessDenied if the access requirements are not met.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Shell.WebForms.ContentWebFormsBase.AccessDenied
member.summary: The method that is invoked when the current users access rights are not suffcient for the operation that he tries to perform.
member.remarks: This method will perform different functions depending on the authentication method in use. If forms authentication is used, then it will redirect the user to the login page as defined in web.config. If windows authentication is used, an Access Denied header (http status 401) will be sent to the client.
member.example: The following code example demonstrates the usage of AccessDenied to deny access to a user that is not logged on. The example is taken from the Web user control LoginStatus.ascx, which is delivered with EPiServer. It must be understood that the click event for ASP.NET Server control Login has been linked to the function Login_Click, so that when the user clicks the Login button, this function is executed. Note that the call to AccessDenied does not necessarily mean that the user is denied access - it can also be used to present the user with a login dialog. This happens in Web user control QuickBar.ascx.

member.name: T:EPiServer.UI.ContentBaseUserControl
member.summary: A utility class to simplify the code in user controls.

remarks.para: ContentBaseUserControl is to EPiServer Web user controls what ContentBaseWebForm is to EPiServer page templates - it provides access to the EPiServer infrastructure. Letting a Web user control inherit EPiServer.UserControlBase instead of the default UserControl turns the standard User Control class into a fully-fledged EPiServer Universe member, with access to EPiServer Web pages and current configuration settings, among other things.

By inheriting from the ContentBaseUserControl class you do not have to cast the IContent properties of the UserControl class to a ContentWebForm class. Instead use the CurrentContent and the other members like you would directly from ContentWebForm or TemplatePage.
The purpose is to give access to frequently used methods and properties of the ContentWebForm class without having to cast the Content property.
remarks.note: This class does not implement IContentSource, even though it mimics the interface by having all the IContentSource methods. The reason for this is that if UserControlBase really implemented IContentSource, it would cause controls such as Property to become contained and non-editable via dope.

member.name: T:EPiServer.UI.Report.Reports.NaiveBoundField
member.summary:
Used in our report grid views to allow listing of pages of different page types in the same view.
The standard BoundField control will throw an exception if not all objects in the grid are of the same type - somehow our typed page proxy classes hide the fact that they are all PageData.
See bug 85019.
